Prompt:
Example 1:
Cat and Dog walk. They walk in their village. Then they see an egg. The egg is in the grass. The egg is alone in the grass. The egg is all alone. Cat and Dog walk to a bird. They ask the bird, "Is this your egg?" But the bird says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the owl. Maybe it is his egg." Cat and Dog walk to the owl. They ask the owl, "Is this your egg?" But the owl says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the goose. Maybe it is her egg." Cat and Dog walk to the goose. They ask the goose, "Is this your egg?" But the goose says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the two ducks. Maybe it is their egg." Cat and Dog walk to the two ducks. They ask the two ducks, "Is this your egg?" But the two ducks say, "No, that is not our egg." Then the egg breaks.

Example 2:
The Sun’s light shines on Earth. The light makes our air, land, and water warm. But some things get
warmer than others.
Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Some people like to play games on computers. They can play games at home or at a friend's house. But computers have special passwords to keep them safe. This is called computer security. If a person knows a computer's password, they can use it to play games and do other things. But if a person doesn’t know the password, they can’t play games or do things on the computer. This keeps the computer safe from people who might try to do bad things. Imagine you have a special box with a lock. If you know the lock's secret, you can open the box and take a toy out. Here is a good starting point: "Computers have a special way to keep our information safe. It is called security. Security helps keep our information from being stolen."

Here is a short paragraph on computer security:

Computers have a special way to keep our information safe. It is called security. Security helps keep our information from being stolen. Just like a lock on a door keeps our things inside safe, security helps keep our computer safe. Imagine you had a secret code that only you knew. If someone else wanted to get into your computer, they would need the secret code. If they didn’t have the code, they couldn’t get in. That would keep your information safe! Just like Cat and Dog asking the bird, the owl, and the goose to see if they knew about the egg, when you log into a website or a computer, you are asking if you have the right secret code. If you don’t have the code, you won’t be able to get in.

The Internet is a big place. There are many people on it. But there are some bad people too. They want to do bad things to our computers. These bad people are called hackers. They can make our computers do bad things too. That is why we need to be safe. We need to have strong passwords. We need to be careful what we click on. We need to tell our parents if someone asks us to give them our password. If you are online, you should always ask a grown-up if it’s okay to do something. 

If you don’t want hackers to get into your computer, you should have a firewall. It’s like a strong wall that keeps them out. You can also use a special program to keep your computer safe. It’s like a police officer that watches over your computer. It will tell you if someone is trying to get in and make them leave. And remember, you should never tell anyone your password. Not even your best friend.

The internet is like a big neighborhood. Just like your neighborhood, there are good things and bad things. On the internet, the bad things are called viruses. They can make your computer sick and hurt it. But you can keep your computer safe with computer security. Computer security is like locking your door to keep the bad things out. These are like strangers knocking on your door. If you don’t know the stranger, don’t open the door. And if you don’t know the link, don’t click on it. Here are the steps to keep your computer secure:
First, make sure you have a strong password. This is like a secret code that only you know. It should be long and hard to guess. Then, keep your computer up to date. This means you need to install new updates regularly. These updates are like fixes for your computer that make it stronger. Next, be careful when you go to websites. Some websites can harm your computer if you visit them. Make sure you visit safe websites only. If you get a message that says your computer is infected with a virus, don’t click on it. A virus is like a bad germ that can harm your computer. Instead, call a grown-up for help. Finally, keep your computer in a safe place. This means you shouldn’t leave it alone in a public place where someone could take it or damage it. By following these steps, you can keep your computer safe and secure.

Note: The readability of the passage has been measured

Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Computer security is like a strong lock on a door. Just like how you need a key to open the lock, a computer needs a secret code to let someone use it. This code is called a password. If you make a strong password, it’s like using a strong key. It keeps bad people from getting into your computer. But if you make a weak password, it’s like using a weak key. It’s easy for bad people to open your door and get into your computer. That’s why you need to make strong passwords. You can use a mix of letters and numbers to make it strong. You can also change your password often to keep it safe. Remember, a strong password is like a strong lock. It keeps your computer safe from bad people. So, always make strong passwords and keep them safe!

- Average sentence length: 7-10 words

A computer is like a house. It has locks. These locks keep bad things from getting in. But sometimes bad things get in. They are like thieves. They steal passwords and other secret things. Then they can do bad things on the computer.
Pretend you have a house with a strong lock. The lock keeps the thieves out. But what if you used a weak lock? The thieves would break in easily.
A computer has a lock too. It’s called a password. If you use a weak password, the thieves can break in easily. So you need a strong lock for your computer. Use a password that is hard to guess. Don’t use your name or your birthday. Use something hard to guess, like a combination of numbers and letters.
If you use a strong lock for your computer, the thieves won’t be able to break in. They won’t be able to steal your secrets. Keep your computer safe! Use a strong password and keep your lock closed.
